questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
The minimum energy that must be possessed by photons in order to produce the photoelectric effect with platinum metal is :

[Given : The threshold frequency of platinum is 1.3 $$\times$$ 1015 s$$-$$1 and h = 6.6 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$34 J s.]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: At 25$$^\circ$$C and 1 atm pressure, the enthalpy of combustion of benzene (I) and acetylene (g) are $$-$$ 3268 kJ mol$$-$$1 and $$-$$1300 kJ mol$$-$$1, respectively. The change in enthalpy for the reaction 3 C2H2(g) $$\to$$ C6H6 (I), is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Solute A associates in water. When 0.7 g of solute A is dissolved in 42.0 g of water, it depresses the freezing point by 0.2$$^\circ$$C. The percentage association of solute A in water, is :

[Given : Molar mass of A = 93 g mol$$-$$1. Molal depression constant of water is 1.86 K kg mol$$-$$1.]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The Ksp for bismuth sulphide (Bi2S3) is 1.08 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$73. The solubility of Bi2S3 in mol L$$-$$1 at 298 K is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The correct order of electron gain enthalpies of Cl, F, Te and Po is

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R :

Assertion A : The amphoteric nature of water is explained by using Lewis acid/base concept.

Reason R : Water acts as an acid with NH3 and as a base with H2S.

In the light of the above statements choose the correct answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
option_texts.B: Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
option_texts.C: A is true but R is false.
option_texts.D: A is false but R is true.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
The correct order of reduction potentials of the following pairs is

A. Cl2/Cl$$-$$

B. I2/I$$-$$

C. Ag+/Ag

D. Na+/Na

E. Li+/Li

Choose the correct answer from the options given below.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The metal ion (in gaseous state) with lowest spin-only magnetic moment value is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.

Assertion A : A mixture contains benzoic acid and napthalene. The pure benzoic acid can be separated out by the use of benzene.

Reason R : Benzoic acid is soluble in hot water.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below.

option_texts.A: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
option_texts.B: Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
option_texts.C: A is true but R is false.
option_texts.D: A is false but R is true.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: During halogen test, sodium fusion extract is boiled with concentrated HNO3 to

option_texts.B: decompose cyanide or sulphide of sodium

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following conditions or reaction sequence will NOT give acetophenone as the major product?

questions.question_text: The major product formed in the following reaction, is

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following ketone will NOT give enamine on treatment with secondary amines? [where t-Bu is $$-$$C(CH3)3]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: A protein 'A' contains 0.30% of glycine (molecular weight 75). The minimum molar mass of the protein 'A' is __________ $$\times$$ 103 g mol$$-$$1 [nearest integer]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Amongst BeF2, BF3, H2O, NH3, CCl4 and HCl, the number of molecules with non-zero net dipole moment is ____________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: At 345 K, the half life for the decomposition of a sample of a gaseous compound initially at 55.5 kPa was 340 s. When the pressure was 27.8 kPa, the half life was found to be 170 s. The order of the reaction is ____________. [integer answer]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
A solution of Fe2(SO4)3 is electrolyzed for 'x' min with a current of 1.5 A to deposit 0.3482 g of Fe. The value of x is ___________. [nearest integer]

Given : 1 F = 96500 C mol$$-$$1

Atomic mass of Fe = 56 g mol$$-$$1

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Amongst FeCl3.3H2O, K3[Fe(CN)6] and [Co(NH3)6]Cl3, the spin-only magnetic moment value of the inner-orbital complex that absorbs light at shortest wavelength is ____________ B.M. [nearest integer]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
How many of the given compounds will give a positive Biuret test ____________ ?

Glycine, Glycylalanine, Tripeptide, Biuret

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
The neutralization occurs when 10 mL of 0.1M acid 'A' is allowed to react with 30 mL of 0.05 M base M(OH)2. The basicity of the acid 'A' is __________.

[M is a metal]

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$A = \{ x \in R:|x + 1| < 2\} $$ and $$B = \{ x \in R:|x - 1| \ge 2\} $$. Then which one of the following statements is NOT true?

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let a, b $$\in$$ R be such that the equation $$a{x^2} - 2bx + 15 = 0$$ has a repeated root $$\alpha$$. If $$\alpha$$ and $$\beta$$ are the roots of the equation $${x^2} - 2bx + 21 = 0$$, then $${\alpha ^2} + {\beta ^2}$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let z1 and z2 be two complex numbers such that $${\overline z _1} = i{\overline z _2}$$ and $$\arg \left( {{{{z_1}} \over {{{\overline z }_2}}}} \right) = \pi $$. Then :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
The system of equations

$$ - kx + 3y - 14z = 25$$

$$ - 15x + 4y - kz = 3$$

$$ - 4x + y + 3z = 4$$

is consistent for all k in the set

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: $$\mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to {\pi  \over 2}} \left( {{{\tan }^2}x\left( {{{(2{{\sin }^2}x + 3\sin x + 4)}^{{1 \over 2}}} - {{({{\sin }^2}x + 6\sin x + 2)}^{{1 \over 2}}}} \right)} \right)$$ is equal to

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The area of the region enclosed between the parabolas y2 = 2x $$-$$ 1 and y2 = 4x $$-$$ 3 is

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Water is being filled at the rate of 1 cm3 / sec in a right circular conical vessel (vertex downwards) of height 35 cm and diameter 14 cm. When the height of the water level is 10 cm, the rate (in cm2 / sec) at which the wet conical surface area of the vessel increases is

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If $${b_n} = \int_0^{{\pi  \over 2}} {{{{{\cos }^2}nx} \over {\sin x}}dx,\,n \in N} $$, then

option_texts.A: $${b_3} - {b_2},\,{b_4} - {b_3},\,{b_5} - {b_4}$$ are in A.P. with common difference $$-$$2
option_texts.B: $${1 \over {{b_3} - {b_2}}},{1 \over {{b_4} - {b_3}}},{1 \over {{b_5} - {b_4}}}$$ are in an A.P. with common difference 2
option_texts.D: $${1 \over {{b_3} - {b_2}}},{1 \over {{b_4} - {b_3}}},{1 \over {{b_5} - {b_4}}}$$ are in an A.P. with common difference $$-$$2

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
If $$y = y(x)$$ is the solution of the differential equation 

$$2{x^2}{{dy} \over {dx}} - 2xy + 3{y^2} = 0$$ such that $$y(e) = {e \over 3}$$, then y(1) is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The value of 2sin (12$$^\circ$$) $$-$$ sin (72$$^\circ$$) is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: A biased die is marked with numbers 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 32 on its faces and the probability of getting a face with mark n is $${1 \over n}$$. If the die is thrown thrice, then the probability, that the sum of the numbers obtained is 48, is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The value of $${\tan ^{ - 1}}\left( {{{\cos \left( {{{15\pi } \over 4}} \right) - 1} \over {\sin \left( {{\pi  \over 4}} \right)}}} \right)$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The line y = x + 1 meets the ellipse $${{{x^2}} \over 4} + {{{y^2}} \over 2} = 1$$ at two points P and Q. If r is the radius of the circle with PQ as diameter then (3r)2 is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
Mathematics
Mathematics
questions.question_text: The value of b > 3 for which $$12\int\limits_3^b {{1 \over {({x^2} - 1)({x^2} - 4)}}dx = {{\log }_e}\left( {{{49} \over {40}}} \right)} $$, is equal to ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If the sum of the co-efficient of all the positive even powers of x in the binomial expansion of $${\left( {2{x^3} + {3 \over x}} \right)^{10}}$$ is $${5^{10}} - \beta \,.\,{3^9}$$, then $$\beta$$ is equal to ____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If the mean deviation about the mean of the numbers 1, 2, 3, .........., n, where n is odd, is $${{5(n + 1)} \over n}$$, then n is equal to ______________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$\overrightarrow b  = \widehat i + \widehat j + \lambda \widehat k$$, $$\lambda$$ $$\in$$ R. If $$\overrightarrow a $$ is a vector such that $$\overrightarrow a  \times \overrightarrow b  = 13\widehat i - \widehat j - 4\widehat k$$ and $$\overrightarrow a \,.\,\overrightarrow b  + 21 = 0$$, then $$\left( {\overrightarrow b  - \overrightarrow a } \right).\,\left( {\widehat k - \widehat j} \right) + \left( {\overrightarrow b  + \overrightarrow a } \right).\,\left( {\widehat i - \widehat k} \right)$$ is equal to _____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The total number of three-digit numbers, with one digit repeated exactly two times, is ______________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$f(x) = |(x - 1)({x^2} - 2x - 3)| + x - 3,\,x \in R$$. If m and M are respectively the number of points of local minimum and local maximum of f in the interval (0, 4), then m + M is equal to ____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let l1 be the line in xy-plane with x and y intercepts $${1 \over 8}$$ and $${1 \over {4\sqrt 2 }}$$ respectively, and l2 be the line in zx-plane with x and z intercepts $$ - {1 \over 8}$$ and $$ - {1 \over {6\sqrt 3 }}$$ respectively. If d is the shortest distance between the line l1 and l2, then d$$-$$2 is equal to _______________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements. One is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.

Assertion A : Two identical balls A and B thrown with same velocity 'u' at two different angles with horizontal attained the same range R. IF A and B reached the maximum height h1 and h2 respectively, then $$R = 4\sqrt {{h_1}{h_2}} $$

Reason R : Product of said heights.

$${h_1}{h_2} = \left( {{{{u^2}{{\sin }^2}\theta } \over {2g}}} \right)\,.\,\left( {{{{u^2}{{\cos }^2}\theta } \over {2g}}} \right)$$

Choose the correct answer :

option_texts.A: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
option_texts.B: Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
option_texts.C: A is true but R is false.
option_texts.D: A is false but R is true.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two buses P and Q start from a point at the same time and move in a straight line and their positions are represented by $${X_P}(t) = \alpha t + \beta {t^2}$$ and $${X_Q}(t) = ft - {t^2}$$. At what time, both the buses have same velocity?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A disc with a flat small bottom beaker placed on it at a distance R from its center is revolving about an axis passing through the center and perpendicular to its plane with an angular velocity $$\omega$$. The coefficient of static friction between the bottom of the beaker and the surface of the disc is $$\mu$$. The beaker will revolve with the disc if :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A solid metallic cube having total surface area 24 m2 is uniformly heated. If its temperature is increased by 10$$^\circ$$C, calculate the increase in volume of the cube. (Given $$\alpha$$ = 5.0 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$4 $$^\circ$$C$$-$$1).

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A copper block of mass 5.0 kg is heated to a temperature of 500$$^\circ$$C and is placed on a large ice block. What is the maximum amount of ice that can melt? [Specific heat of copper : 0.39 J g$$-$$1 $$^\circ$$C$$-$$1 and latent heat of fusion of water : 335 J g$$-$$1]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The ratio of specific heats $$\left( {{{{C_P}} \over {{C_V}}}} \right)$$ in terms of degree of freedom (f) is given by :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: For a particle in uniform circular motion, the acceleration $$\overrightarrow a $$ at any point P(R, $$\theta$$) on the circular path of radius R is (when $$\theta$$ is measured from the positive x-axis and v is uniform speed) :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two metallic plates form a parallel plate capacitor. The distance between the plates is 'd'. A metal sheet of thickness $${d \over 2}$$ and of area equal to area of each plate is introduced between the plates. What will be the ratio of the new capacitance to the original capacitance of the capacitor?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two cells of same emf but different internal resistances r1 and r2 are connected in series with a resistance R. The value of resistance R, for which the potential difference across second cell is zero, is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : Susceptibilities of paramagnetic and ferromagnetic substances increase with decrease in temperature.

Statement II : Diamagnetism is a result of orbital motions of electrons developing magnetic moments opposite to the applied magnetic field.

Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
option_texts.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
option_texts.C: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
option_texts.D: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A long solenoid carrying a current produces a magnetic field B along its axis. If the current is doubled and the number of turns per cm is halved, the new value of magnetic field will be equal to

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A sinusoidal voltage V(t) = 210 sin 3000 t volt is applied to a series LCR circuit in which L = 10 mH, C = 25 $$\mu$$F and R = 100 $$\Omega$$. The phase difference ($$\Phi $$) between the applied voltage and resultant current will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The electromagnetic waves travel in a medium at a speed of 2.0 $$\times$$ 108 m/s. The relative permeability of the medium is 1.0. The relative permittivity of the medium will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The interference pattern is obtained with two coherent light sources of intensity ratio 4 : 1. And the ratio $${{{I_{\max }} + {I_{\min }}} \over {{I_{\max }} - {I_{\min }}}}$$ is $${5 \over x}$$. Then, the value of x will be equal to :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A light whose electric field vectors are completely removed by using a good polaroid, allowed to incident on the surface of the prism at Brewster's angle. Choose the most suitable option for the phenomenon related to the prism.

option_texts.A: Reflected and refracted rays will be perpendicular to each other.
option_texts.B: Wave will propagate along the surface of prism.
option_texts.C: No refraction, and there will be total reflection of light.
option_texts.D: No reflection, and there will be total transmission of light.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A proton, a neutron, an electron and an $$\alpha$$ particle have same energy. If $$\lambda$$p, $$\lambda$$n, $$\lambda$$e and $$\lambda$$a are the de Broglie's wavelengths of proton, neutron, electron and $$\alpha$$ particle respectively, then choose the correct relation from the following :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Identify the logic operation performed by the given circuit:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: If n represents the actual number of deflections in a converted galvanometer of resistance G and shunt resistance S. Then the total current I when its figure of merit is K will be:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: For $$z = {a^2}{x^3}{y^{{1 \over 2}}}$$, where 'a' is a constant. If percentage error in measurement of 'x' and 'y' are 4% and 12% respectively, then the percentage error for 'z' will be _______________%.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A curved in a level road has a radius 75 m. The maximum speed of a car turning this curved road can be 30 m/s without skidding. If radius of curved road is changed to 48 m and the coefficient of friction between the tyres and the road remains same, then maximum allowed speed would be ___________ m/s.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A block of mass 200 g is kept stationary on a smooth inclined plane by applying a minimum horizontal force F = $$\sqrt{x}$$N as shown in figure.



The value of x = _____________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Moment of Inertia (M.I.) of four bodies having same mass 'M' and radius '2R' are as follows:

I1 = M.I. of solid sphere about its diameter

I2 = M.I. of solid cylinder about its axis

I3 = M.I. of solid circular disc about its diameter

I4 = M.I. of thin circular ring about its diameter

If 2(I2 + I3) + I4 = x . I1, then the value of x will be __________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two satellites S1 and S2 are revolving in circular orbits around a planet with radius R1 = 3200 km and R2 = 800 km respectively. The ratio of speed of satellite S1 to be speed of satellite S2 in their respective orbits would be $${1 \over x}$$ where x = ___________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: When a gas filled in a closed vessel is heated by raising the temperature by 1$$^\circ$$C, its pressure increases by 0.4%. The initial temperature of the gas is ___________ K.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: 27 identical drops are charged at 22V each. They combine to form a bigger drop. The potential of the bigger drop will be _____________ V.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The length of a given cylindrical wire is increased to double of its original length. The percentage increase in the resistance of the wire will be ____________ %.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In a series LCR circuit, the inductance, capacitance and resistance are L = 100 mH, C = 100 $$\mu$$F and R = 10 $$\Omega$$ respectively. They are connected to an AC source of voltage 220 V and frequency of 50 Hz. The approximate value of current in the circuit will be ___________ A.
